ans.reasoning: The method join(Object[] array, String separator) checks if the array is null and returns null, but it also calls another join method with the same array. If the array is null, it should not proceed to call the next join method, which could lead to a NullPointerException.

The method join(Object[] array, String separator, int startIndex, int endIndex) also checks if the array is null, but it does not handle the case where the array is null properly. It could lead to a NullPointerException when trying to access elements of the array.

The method join(T... elements) simply calls another join method with the elements and does not perform any null checks itself. It is less suspicious compared to the other methods since it relies on the behavior of the other join methods.
